messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/6/2004 9:09:47 AM Central Standard Time, dezigna@comcast.net writes: When I  was a girl in school if you had a cold you were supposed to
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/6/2004 9:09:47 AM Central Standard Time,
dezigna@... writes:

When I was a girl in school if you had a cold you were supposed to stay home
to recover and not spread the thing. I was in schools in several countries
and that is one thing they had in common. Mum (or my grandmother) just
phoned the office to tell them I would be absent.


~~~

Can't do that now. The school won't believe you. In Memphis, if you miss
more than 5 days in a semester, you can be up on truancy charges. That means
if your child is feeling poorly for a day, but is not sick enough to go to
the doctor, you can only do that 5 times. The next time you better run her
into the doctor, even if you don't have a co-pay or health insurance, or they
could prosecute you.

It's pretty ridiculous. Have to keep that average daily attendance up, you
know?

I don't feel like getting and up and going early at least once or twice a
week. I'm so glad we don't have to.

Karen


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
